newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine peso closes firmer in range-bound trade.
newsitem.headline: Philippine peso closes firmer in range-bound trade.

text.p: * Central Bank keeps to the sidelines
The Philippine peso settled a notch firmer at 26.245 to the dollar after fluctuating within a narrow range throughout the session, traders said.
The peso closed at 26.246 to the dollar on Monday.
The Central Bank was absent from the market setting its buying rate at 26.230 and the selling rate at 26.250.
The peso swung from a low of 26.246 to a high of 26.241.
One trader said foreign banks were buying dollars in the afternoon due to higher demand.
Foreign exchange corporations, subsidiaries of banks which trade in the retail market, were swamped with demand for dollars, he added.
He estimated the demand to be around $30 million.
A total of $84.2 million was traded in the market.
